Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that six ministers were asked to step aside, when in reality, only five ministers were asked to step aside.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide evidence or sources to back up the statement.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that none of the dropped ministers made it to court because the allegations against them had no basis, which may be a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation to the claim, as two of the dropped ministers were actually charged in court for their alleged wrongdoings.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by providing inaccurate information about the number of ministers asked to step aside and their legal proceedings.
Understate: The claim may understate the extent of the issue by not acknowledging the full number of ministers who were asked to step aside.
